subsection.name: Add Dependencies
subsection.p: Make sure you have the forge Maven2 repository reference and dependency definition in the root pom.xml of your project.

div.source:
<repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<repository> <id>hippo-content-exim-maven-repo</id> <name>Hippo Content EXIM (Export / Import) Maven 2 Repository</name> <url>http://forge.onehippo.org/svn/content-exim/maven2/</url> </repository>
<!-- SNIP -->
</repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencyManagement>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
<!-- NOTE: You should set a property named 'forge.content-exim.version' to a version of this plugin! -->
<dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.content-exim</groupId> <artifactId>content-exim-core</artifactId> <version>${forge.content-exim.version}</version> </dependency>
<!-- The following is optional: Include this only when you want to bootstrap example groovy updater scripts. --> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.content-exim</groupId> <artifactId>content-exim-updater-examples</artifactId> <version>${forge.content-exim.version}</version> </dependency>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencyManagement>

subsection.p: And add the following dependency reference into your application subproject.

div.source:
<dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.content-exim</groupId> <artifactId>content-exim-core</artifactId> </dependency>
<!-- The following is optional: Include this in CMS application module only when you want to bootstrap example groovy updater scripts. --> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.content-exim</groupId> <artifactId>content-exim-updater-examples</artifactId> </dependency>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencies>

subsection.p: Now, you're ready to use the plugin!
